intro: Tripogandra disgrega f. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular tripogandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its clustered, glandular-pubescent stems and small, often inconspicuous flowers. The leaves are typically alternate, narrow, and covered with fine, glandular hairs. This plant is often found in rocky or dry habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the genus Tripogandra.
